highlights.description: Cobra CLI with read, plan, apply, create, and serve commands
MCP server for AI assistant integration with 7 presentation tools
Shared operations layer (`ops` package) powering both CLI and MCP

added.description: `slidekit read` command to output presentations in TOON or JSON format
`slidekit plan` command to compute diff between current and desired state
`slidekit apply` command to apply changes with `--confirm` requirement
`slidekit create` command to create presentations from stdin JSON
`slidekit serve` command to start MCP server on stdio
MCP `read_deck` tool to read presentations in TOON/JSON format
MCP `list_slides` tool to list slide IDs and titles
MCP `get_slide` tool to retrieve single slide by ID
MCP `plan_changes` tool to compute diff between states
MCP `apply_changes` tool to apply diff with confirmation requirement
MCP `create_deck` tool to create new presentations
MCP `update_slide` tool to update single slide with confirmation
`ops` package with shared logic: `ReadDeck`, `PlanChanges`, `ApplyChanges`, `CreateDeck`
`ops` package slide operations: `ListSlides`, `GetSlide`, `UpdateSlide`
Backend registry for managing presentation backends
`EncodeSlide` method to TOONEncoder for single slide encoding

tests.description: 27 unit tests for `ops` package with real file I/O

highlights.description: Initial release with canonical slide model, Marp backend, and TOON format

added.description: Canonical data model: `Deck`, `Section`, `Slide`, `Block`, `Audio`, `Diff`
Marp Markdown reader with frontmatter, directives, and speaker notes parsing
Marp Markdown writer with lossless round-tripping
Backend interface: `Read`, `Write`, `Plan`, `Apply`, `Create`
TOON encoder for token-optimized AI output (~8x smaller than JSON)
7 slide layouts: title, title_body, title_two_col, section, blank, image, comparison
7 block types: paragraph, bullet, numbered, code, image, quote, heading
Audio metadata support for TTS and video generation
Section detection via `_class: section-divider` directives

tests.description: 30 test cases covering reader, writer, and TOON encoder
